content: chore: adaptations for nightly-2025-01-21 #20912 Please review this PR. At the end of the month this diff will land in .

Something slightly unfortunate here: I took the name List.indexOf_lt_length for a weaker lemma, and so have renamed Mathlib's List.indexOf_lt_length to List.indexOf_lt_length_iff. There's no way to add deprecation hints in this situation, however.

You can rename+deprecate in master and then drop the deprecation in the next release, no? That doesn't help dependents that only bump from one stable release to the next, but it does help anybody who's bumping more frequently
When we finally sit down and write lake exe auto_update, having step-by-step deprecations and instructions for each commit to master would be helpful.

I am out of time for Mathlib until next week, but, just agreeing with Ruben here, we should:

  • make a PR to Mathlib renaming List.indexOf_lt_length to List.indexOf_lt_length_iff, and deprecating
  • merge that
  • when we merge master back to nightly-testing, remove the deprecation (because it will conflict with the upstream version)

If anyone is able to make that happen while I'm away, that's great, otherwise I'll get to it, probably next Sunday.

(Separately, I'll be rewriting lots of the List/Array indexOf lemmas soon, but I can't be sure whether that will happen by the next release, so we should proceed here on the basis that isn't happening.)
#20939 takes care of the first point.
